subject: Best practices for parameterizing JUnit executions?

messageBody:
Hi all,
Here's a question for possible JUnit FAQ inclusion:

"How do I pass command-line arguments to a test execution?"

For example, I'm running a test that does something with a file. I'd
like to make the filename configurable, not hardcoded, so that
the test can be run with different inputs. The test is also more
portable this way, with the file not having to have a specific path
that is hardcoded. Anyway, how do I get that argument into JUnit,
particularly when running thru the GUI? I've heard some people say
that the only way to do this is via system properties set at the
command line invocation of the test runner, but I was hoping there
might be another way.

Related to this, what is the best practice for sharing properties
among tests? That is, suppose we were able to get that filename
property into the test execution - how would all the different test
cases know about it? One way would be for all the TestCases to
subclass some other TestCase subclass that had the filename set on it
as a static property. But this seems a little hacked. Is there a
best practice for this?

Thanks,
Noah Green
